greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Width (number of leaves) of the rooted tree with Matula-Goebel number 2^n - 1.
comment: Every positive integer has a unique q-factorization (encoded by A324924) into factors q(i) = prime(i)/i, i > 0. For example:
For n > 1, a(n) is the multiplicity of q(1) = 2 in the q-factorization of 2^n - 1.
link: Keith Briggs, Matula numbers and rooted trees.
example: The rooted tree with Matula-Goebel number 2047 = 2^11 - 1 is (((o)(o))(ooo(o))), which has 6 leaves (o's), so a(11) = 6.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, May 12 2019
